reviews.text:
Tried the black pepper oyster mushroom set and mock fish Noddle soup.  Very nice, lots of ingredients as shown in the photos.  The rice for was mixed with lots of seaweed and floss. The chief is friendly.

The ambience is only 3 star as it is a located at industrial area (opposite Vicom Kaki Bt) the eating place not cooling enough.  Good thing is the place not too pack.

Delicious, generously portioned meals! The noodles and rice dishes are expertly prepared with a delightful Japanese twist, making every bite a flavorful experience. Highly recommended for anyone craving quality food!

Food is a delightful and satisfying meal. The chicken is incredibly tender and moist, with a subtle but flavorful seasoning that shines through. The accompanying rice is fragrant and perfectly cooked, having absorbed the rich chicken broth. The dipping sauce is a fantastic complement, offering a tangy and slightly spicy kick that elevates the entire dish. For a taste of authentic and comforting Thai cuisine, this chicken rice is a must-try.

I recently visited Veggie Trend, and it was a delightful experience from start to finish. The food was exceptional, bursting with flavors that truly highlighted the best of vegetarian cuisine. Each dish was meticulously prepared, showcasing a perfect balance of taste and texture.

The uncle at Veggie Trend was friendly and attentive, making the dining experience even more enjoyable. His positive attitude and willingness to accommodate special requests contributed to a warm and inviting atmosphere.

One of the standout features of Veggie Trend is its wide variety of dishes. The extensive menu offers something for everyone, from traditional favorites to innovative new creations. Whether you're a long-time vegetarian or just exploring meat-free options, the diverse selection ensures that you'll find something to love. Overall, Veggie Trend is a must-visit for anyone seeking delicious vegetarian food served with great hospitality. Trust me, its deliciousüòã

Newly opened vegetarian stall. I guess this is the cheapest vegetarian western food in Singapore. They are selling delicious and affordable food. üëçüèº Can get Chinese, western, Vietnamese vegetarian food.

Owner said they usually close at 5pm Ôºã(Monday to Friday) and Saturday half day until 2pm. Sunday closed.
